name: NPR
text:
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences says 45% of those invited to join its membership this year are women and 36% are from underrepresented ethnic and racial communities.

However, the Academy remains largely white and male overall.
https://t.co/xsFZixL7QM

name: NPR
text: President Trump says painting "Black Lives Matter" on the street that runs in front of Trump Tower would amount to "denigrating this luxury Avenue," and hopes New York City police "won‚Äôt let this symbol of hate be affixed to New York‚Äôs greatest street." https://t.co/iORHpxr6eZ

name: NPR
text:
Feras Fayyad was the first witness to testify in a trial examining state-sponsored torture in President Bashar Assad‚Äôs Syria. His case involves an alleged rape.

‚ÄúWe need to know who is committing these crimes,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThere is no way to stay silent.‚Äù https://t.co/aPjL0iiJbg

name: NPR
text: From Billie Holiday to Kendrick Lamar, this list of 50 songs compiles a century of Black musicians showing what America's official histories would hide in plain sight: the destructiveness of white supremacy. https://t.co/OnJMjl0n0u

name: NPR
text:
Russian voters have overwhelmingly backed a referendum on constitutional changes that include a provision allowing President Vladimir Putin ‚Äî who has already served for some 2 decades ‚Äî to remain in power until 2036.

name: NPR
text:
A group of former George W. Bush administration officials have formed a new super PAC to endorse Joe Biden and "engage and mobilize disenchanted GOP voters."
https://t.co/eIwkSeLgLK

name: NPR
text:
NPR reviewed over 40 recent federal cases against protesters who threw Molotov cocktails or started fires damaging police property. 

This one is the only instance in which 924(c) ‚Äî a charge that carries a mandatory minimum of 30 years in prison ‚Äî appears. https://t.co/L91tHetvKB

name: NPR
text:
The Atlanta Hawks have committed their arena as an early voting site for Georgia's upcoming elections. The basketball team is challenging others in the NBA to become civically involved ahead of November.
https://t.co/rOqvLGyjg7

name: NPR
text:
Boston officials have voted to remove a copy of Thomas Ball's sculpture "Emancipation Memorial," which has stood since 1879 and depicts a formerly enslaved man kneeling before Abraham Lincoln.
"https://t.co/Ls8DiQoIez

name: NPR
text:
After Trump pushed for their revival, fireworks will return to Mount Rushmore ‚Äî despite a decade ban due to environmental dangers and protests by Sioux people who accuse the U.S. of breaking an 1868 treaty.

The 7,500 spectators won't be told to don masks.
https://t.co/AxYbg5rg9T

name: NPR
text:
NEW: Joe Biden raised a record $141 million in June compared to $131 million brought in by President Trump's campaign. It's the second straight month that Biden has outpaced Trump's fundraising haul.
https://t.co/2Y1oGMBT65

name: NPR
text:
Dr. Anthony Fauci says it's not too late to avoid the dire picture outlined in his congressional testimony of 100,000 coronavirus cases a day in the U.S.

"It's really in our hands as a community, as a nation, as a populace to make this happen," he says. https://t.co/qC2s0CLuNJ

name: NPR
text:
The U.N. Security Council passed a resolution calling for a 90-day cease-fire in conflict zones due to the impact of COVID-19. 

It took months to pass a coronavirus-related resolution due to tussling between the U.S. and China over a reference to the WHO. https://t.co/ag2VZUpVNz

name: NPR
text:
As coworkers began getting sick, Yudelka took an unpaid leave of absence. When she got her unemployment benefits, she realized something: She was getting more money than she was as an essential worker.
https://t.co/GwpmVNtFGe

name: NPR
text:
Abbas has worked in a Kabul cemetery for more than a decade, sometimes being called to help bury victims of militant attacks.

But the last six weeks, during the pandemic, are the busiest he's ever seen.
https://t.co/OJEps2hNMo

name: NPR
text: Many African American doctors say medical training alienates them, leaving them underrepresented in the field ‚Äî and perpetuating a sense that medical and mental health care is not of, or for, the Black community. https://t.co/4JHqrdEHF1

name: NPR
text: How do you bring back a struggling neighborhood? A coalition of community groups wants to try something new in Chicago: Take hundreds of unused city lots and quickly build 1,000 affordable, single-family homes. @WBEZ https://t.co/AeUXT0khOG
